result.execSummary:
The defendant Gordon A. Belille was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence w/held probation 5 years - Fine/Costs $1189.00 and $40.00 to LCO Police Dept. - 6 months county jail with huber/work release and 133 days credit time served - DNA sample and surcharge - No contact with Timothy Stevens and any counseling DOC may impose

miscConds.notes: Fine $939.50   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Surcharge $250.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Gordon A. Belille in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Gordon A. Belille in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State recites plea agreement.  Defendant entered plea of guilty.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Court finds defendant guilty. 

COURT:  Sentence w/held probation 5 years - 6 months Sawyer County jail with credit for 133 days time served - Fine/costs $1189.50 - No contact with Timothy Stevens - DNA sample and surcharge -  $40.00 to be paid to LCO Police Department - any counseling DOC may impose.

Court addressed the defendant as to his right to have a preliminary exam.  Defendant does not wish to have a prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam.  Finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Gordon A. Belille in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Gordon A. Belille in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:59 AM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  State makes stmt.  Atty Chapman addressed the court defendant will waive prelim.  Arraignment scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Defendant Gordon A. Belille in court, in custody by Video.  Bruce Poquette in court for State.   DEF was just appointed counsel, initial appearance adjourned.   Bond Continues.

Defendant Gordon A. Belille in court with attorney Martin Jarvis (Special Appearance) .  Defendant Gordon A. Belille in custody appeared by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   Public Defender to appoint counsel, and address preliminary hearing issues.  Bond Continues.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Gordon A. Belille in court, in custody appearing by video.   Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court sets bond.  Initial appearance set for July 21, 2015 @ 8:30 am.
